name: aws-tui
description: AWS TUI (Ink) for EC2 and S3 with read-only guardrails.

scripts.install:man: sh -c 'MAN_PREFIX=${MAN_PREFIX:-/usr/local}; TARGET="$MAN_PREFIX/share/man/man1"; if mkdir -p "$TARGET" 2>/dev/null && install -m 0644 man/aws-tui.1 "$TARGET/"; then echo "man page -> $TARGET/aws-tui.1"; else FALLBACK="$HOME/.local/share/man/man1"; if mkdir -p "$FALLBACK" && install -m 0644 man/aws-tui.1 "$FALLBACK/"; then echo "man page -> $FALLBACK/aws-tui.1 (fallback)"; else echo "man page install failed; try: sudo MAN_PREFIX=$MAN_PREFIX npm run install:man" >&2; exit 1; fi; fi'
scripts.install:global: npm run build && npm install -g . && npm run install:man
